content: 1 cold metal mitts by barbelle trish hernacki metal is an incredible heat conductor when you touch it it transfers heat away from your hand making it feel even colder than the ambient temperature when it s well below freezing outside there isn t much worse than grabbing something metallic with bare hands the cold metal mitts were designed specifically to shield your hands from those brutal temperatures worked in two- color brioche the cold metal mitts are thick enough to keep out the cold while leaving your fingers free to move or grasp the visually alluring contrast of vertical and horizontal stripes adds a notch of style to these functional mitts #coldmetalmitts coldmetalmitts_v1 0 ©barbelle 2025 this pattern and included photos are intended for personal use only pattern and items made from pattern may not be sold or distributed 2 information and materials skill level intermediate recommended yarn farmer s daughter fibers pishkun 100% montana and wyoming rambouillet wool 255 yards/100g sample shown in main color castle rock and contrast color elk antler any dk weight yarn that meets required stitch gauge non-superwash wool highly recommended for best texture needles and notions us 4 3 5mm needles with long circular cord for magic loop or dpn us 4 3 5mm dpn for thumb stitch holder or scrap yarn scissors tapestry needle stitch marker stitch gauge 4 x 4 10cm x 10cm blocked = 21 stitches x 26 row in two-color brioche stitch in the round construction and notes mitts are worked from the bottom up beginning with a garter stitch cuff the body of the mitts is worked in two-color brioche the thumb gusset is created with basic brioche increases and the live thumb stitches put on hold to be worked when the body is finished upon finishing the body with a garter cuff the thumb stitches are then picked up and finished with dpns this is a two-handed pattern the thumb gusset is placed based on right and left hands in order to keep the mirrored aesthetic of the gusset increases instructions for right and left mitt thumb gussets are separate all hands are unique feel free to modify or customize the length or circumference based on any wearer s individual needs keep in mind any modifications will alter yardage suggestions circumferential modification brioche is a 2 stitch repeat so any change in circumference must be made by a factor of 2
